projects.name: Battle Ship
projects.body: Battle Ship is a Battle Ship game I made for my Java class. The goal of this project was to use good object oriented style to create the game. I decided to go with a slightly modified Model, View aproach. For this project I also decided to try out Java Swing, a Java UI framework. I found using this framework most interesting and at times challenging.

projects.name: Spikes
projects.body: Spikes is a game created in Ruby with Gosu. I decided to try and replicated the mobile game [Don't Touch The Spikes](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.ketchapp.donttouchthespikes&hl=en). One of the major challenges I encountered was making my own physics engine since Gosu does not come with a physics engine to start with.

projects.name: NoahHuppert.com
projects.body: NoahHuppert.com is the web that is the current website. I designed this website using [Knockout Js](http://knockoutjs.com/) for a data binding library along with [Sass](http://sass-lang.com/) and [TypeScript](http://www.typescriptlang.org/). KnockoutJs makes it possible to bind the value of a varible TODO content
